{/* Header Section */}
November 9, 2024

ðŸš€ How I Built the Nuke Grab Tool (Without Being a Coding Expert)

By Martin Tomek
{["Nuke", "Python", "Workflow", "Technical Guide"].map(tag => ( {tag} ))}
{/* Main Content */}
{/* Introduction */}
You know that feeling when you're working in Nuke, and you keep thinking "there has to be a better way"? That's exactly how this story begins. After spending countless hours in Blender's node editor and falling in love with its grab tool, I couldn't shake the thought: "Why can't we have this in Nuke?"
{/* The Journey Begins */}

The Journey Begins ðŸ’¡

I'm not a professional programmer - far from it. But one night, frustrated with moving nodes around in Nuke, I decided to try something different. I'd heard about this AI called Claude that was pretty good with Nuke's Python API. So I thought, "What's the worst that could happen?"

{/* The AI Partnership */}

Enter Claude: My AI Programming Partner ðŸ¤–

Me:

Hey Claude, I love how Blender's grab tool works with nodes. Could we make something similar for Nuke?

Claude:

Absolutely! Let's break this down into simple steps. First, we'll need to capture the 'E' key press...

20 minutes later, I had a working prototype. It wasn't perfect, but it WORKED! ðŸŽ‰

{/* The GitHub Journey */}

The GitHub Chronicles ðŸ“ˆ

October 2, 2024
First Commit: The Birth

Basic functionality implemented - nodes finally following orders!

October 3, 2024
Version 3.2

Fixed scaling issues and made it work smoothly at different zoom levels

October 6, 2024
Version 3.8

Added Ctrl+Z support and middle-click freeze functionality

{/* Encouragement Section */}

A Message to Fellow Artists ðŸ’ª

If you're sitting there thinking "I wish Nuke could do X" but you're not a coder - that's exactly where I was! With tools like Claude AI and a bit of curiosity, you might be surprised how quickly you can turn your ideas into reality.

  • Start with a clear idea of what you want
  • Break it down into simple steps
  • Use Claude AI to help with the code
  • Test in Nuke's Script Editor
  • Don't be afraid to make mistakes
{/* Call to Action */}
Get it on Nukepedia View on GitHub
